<gallery>
Fichier:Syphilis chancre LISA.jpg|alt=The description: single, clean-bottomed, painless and indurated is not always de rigueur. Here the background is fibrinous. Any ulceration of the genitals is syphilis until proven otherwise.|Syphilitic chancre: painless ulceration opposite the frenulum of the penis.
</gallery>

question.question: What is a characteristic of a chancre in primary syphilis?
question.option_a: It is usually painful and bleeds easily.
question.option_b: It is a painless, indurated ulceration, often appearing at the site of initial exposure.
question.option_c: It is a small, flat, and scaly lesion.
question.option_d: It is typically accompanied by severe itching and discharge.
